lines.text: It seems I'm always ringside at the first fight... and the last.

[to Fluff]
Say, what did you worry about before you met me?

[looks him over]
Mmm, I'll bet plenty of 'em do, honey.

[to Ward]
Maybe I was feeling a little too girl scouty today.
It looks like we're going to get along fine.
Nick, you don't notice a lot of things. You're so wrapped up in the game that, well, you forget people have... have feelings and are human.
Well, there isn't any room for feelings in this game. A fighter's a machine, not a human being.

[about Ward]
That bellhop certainly has a magog for the dolls, all righr.

[to Ward]
You think you're cute? Your pants are too long to be that cute.
[He cuts the pant legs off of Ward's uniform with a knife]
Say, did you ever see a bellhop didn't want to be a fighter?

[to Ward]
All you got to do is hang that right on his spinach box, and he'll fold.

[to Fluff]
I've known you a long time. They can't beat aces.

[to Marie]
Nickie is a manager of boxfighters, not of people's hearts. I go to bed now.

[about Ward]
I'll take care of that guppy!
